name: Lotus Honolulu

reviews.text: As many reviewers have indicated Aqua Lotus sets itself apart from the mega chain hotels on Waikiki. Placed between a beautiful city park and a small beautiful beach we found it to be a perfect location. If you need to be in the center of all the "action" this definitely wouldn't be the hotel for you however if you enjoy a 15 minute walk to breakfast or a stroll at night back to your room this is perfect. The free bikes also made a great impression being able to check out the local neighborhood first hand instead out of a car window. The complimentary coffee and evening wine was also a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Quiet Escape on Waikiki

reviews.text: If you like to be away from the hustle and close to a residential experience. Aqua Lotus is excellent. The staff is very helpful and friendly There is an excellent beach 100 yards from the hotel where locals and tourists swim.. There is complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon, however the hotel does not have a restaurant and that is the only deficit that reduces the star rating. If they just had a croissant and scone in the AM and some fruit in the PM would help. There is a restaurant next door in the New Otani. I prefer the ambiance of a laid back hotel because the guests tend to be laid back. It is a 15 min beautiful walk along the waterfront to Waikiki shopping . The feeling is one of relationship building between hotel and guests, that is hard to do in a commercial center like Honolulu. The Aqua Lotus is committed to service, value and hospitality. Try Tokkuri Tei sushi reasonably close by and Diamond Head Grill for breakfast scones.
reviews.title: Friendly simple modern relaxed gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Aqua Lotus was great. Loved the rooms. The wood laminate flooring was such a nice change from the grungy carpet most hotels have. The complimentary slippers were a great little extra! I loved the bathroom set-up. Plenty of space, and the shelving for the towels and the basket for the used towels was a nice touch. Felt more like an inviting guest bath rather than a standard hotel bathroom. As many others have stated, the location is peaceful and quiet compared to the rest of Waikiki, and the view of Diamond head with the sun rising behind it in the morning is beautiful! Wish I could wake up to that every morning! Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Aqua Lotus!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Glad we chose this hotel as we found Waikiki completely crazy. It is near enough to walk to but far enough away to be peaceful. It is a nice walk (about 10-15 minutes depending on your speed) into Waikiki and you can enjoy the ocean views all along the way.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel, away from the madness of Waikiki

reviews.text: We had a really nice mountain view room on 4th floor with a good view of Diamond Head. It isn't worth paying more for an ocean view room because, as noted by other reviewers, the view is obscured by other buildings. It is worth noting there is no bath although we were happy with the shower. The room was spotlessly clean and well maintained by the housekeeping staff throughout our seven night stay.
reviews.title: Lotus Hotel

reviews.text: Aqua Lotus Honolulu is the place to stay when you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I love this hotel, as I am always greeted with genuine hospitality and welcoming smiles of the ENTIRE staff! Rooms have been renovated, which are clean and simple, yet modern. The view of Diamond Head is magnificent, especially when you are greeted with the view from the balcony of your room. Hotel location is steps away from Waikiki beach and to Kapiolani Park, which is perfect to stroll along during anytime of the day. Hotel offers great amenities for all types of guests, such as free use of bicycles, beach chairs, a complimentary wine hour, yoga sessions, daily coffee/tea service in the morning and free daily newspaper. Aqua Lotus Honolulu will always be my home away from home!
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in late September - even with a small discount we still felt the Aqua Lotus was overpriced. The hotel is small and cute, beach access via the hotel next door (very small quiet beach), nice amenities (free cruiser bike usage, yoga, wine hour, etc). However, the room was small and fairly basic. The bed was very comfortable though. You're basically paying for the location. Only one elevator for the whole hotel. Yoga was too early for us 7:30 am (when we arrived later just the night before) but we did ride bikes to dinner which was fun. A nice place to stay but about $100 overpriced. Could have stayed at a resort for just a little bit more.
reviews.title: If you're looking for a quiet place to stay

reviews.text: It is a great location and the customer service was exceptional. They always made you feel welcome! A peaceful place with a beautiful beach.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean
reviews.title: Quiet, convieniant, great location for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are in our early 50's. Close enough to walk to big beach or shopping areas. We used the complimentary bikes almost daily, never nervous in the traffic. Everyoneof the staff was very freindly and helpful. Had a view of Diamond Head and partial view of ocean. Nice small local beach for quiet time & swimming and big beach close to swim, read or people watch. We were lucky to be there when they closed down the main beach street for the night. lots of local tents and food.
reviews.title: Great hotel- well managed

reviews.text: Loved the hotel. The addition of complimentary coffee, yoga and wine in afternoon is awesome. Loved the decor of the hotel, it was nice and quiet and the location was great as well. I would highly recommend this hotel if your wanting a fantastic stay in Hawaii. Mahalo
reviews.title: Great time in Honolulu

reviews.text: Fresh coffee and complimentary newspapers in the morning and wine in the evening make a nice welcome in this zen inspired lobby. The front desk, valet and housekeeping work as a team to make your stay hum along as perfect as can be. The modern, spacious rooms with wifi, and view of DH from a private lanai are fantastic. Nightly turn down service and super comfy beds, pillows, sheets...There's lots of great eateries nearby and a fridge to store your wine, juice, milk, etc. So close to all the action of Waikiki, yet just far enough to make you feel not like a tourist, but an actual resident.
reviews.title: This boutique hotel has excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lucky us! Our 25th anniversary, and they had recently remodeled rooms! Decor was very nice, rooms spotless. Staff friendly and aimed to please. Loved the wine happy hour from 4-6:00. Parking not inexpensive, but our car was easily accessible from valet staff. Convenient for our desires....quiet and a quick walk to Waikiki, and other amenities.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Hotel located close to the beach,quite area, 15 min walk from Waikiki.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Service is excellent.Rooms are clean, hotel has complimentary towels and mats for the beach.
reviews.title: Far from the madding crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travel extensively, myself professionally as a medical practitioner for conferences, and both of us for recreation. We decided on aqua lotus based on reviews on trip advisor, the other hotels we contemplated were Halekulani and The Modern. We stayed for 7 nights.
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was generally as described in previous reviews, furnished in an islander style. We opted to upgrade to a premium diamond head view room based on previous reviews suggesting the ocean view rooms were obscured by propoerties closer to the beach (true). Our room was on the 5th floor and we really had no view of the mount as there was a large tree at the front of the property obscuring it. We did however have an excellent view of the large car park next door. Although disappointed by this, the room itself was well furnished and comfortable, the king-size bed likewise comfortable. The TV was a large screen plasma although there was no pay tv...In Australia most hotels would have this avaialble, not sure if the lack of this is the norm for Hawaii??
reviews.title: A touch of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previously described on this site, there is no pool, the beach being about 200 meters away. The hotel provides towels/ mats/ beach chairs gratis. The hotel provides free wine with the oddly named 'happy ending' although we only partook of this the first night as it would best be described as cheap, and we stuck to Japanese beer purchased at a nearby convenience store. There is no restaurant or really any conveniently located reasonable option for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also had a concern with the reception staff's lack of local knowledge. We sought information regarding directions via bus to the local clothing outlets and were given a convoluted google based route involving about 4-5 different buses. We eventually worked out that there was a direct trolley to these. Then we wanted a bus to the northern beaches which were lovely. Again we were given misinformation and almost missed our intended bus as a result. Unfortunately there is no dedicated tourist information and therefore most tourists would rely on front of house staff. Aqua Lotus would do well to keep this in mind.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at Aqua Lotus

reviews.text: Overall we had a pleasant stay, but I'm not sure against what benchmark those that rate this hotel consistently at 5 are using. We had a chance to inspect the Halekulani and when we return will be staying there.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

description: A sophisticated enclave located on the famed Gold Coast of Waikiki, the Aqua Lotus Honolulu, formerly W Honolulu, is a fusion of Asian inspired décor and warm Hawaiian hospitality. Nestled between Kapiolani Park and a spectacular white sand beach shared with Outrigger Canoe Club, this hotel offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki with remarkable views of majestic Diamond Head and the ocean. Amenities include in-room Internet & WiFi Internet access, safe, complimentary coffee and tea service in the lobby, daily wine service in lobby, valet and concierge services, banquet/meeting facilities, beach butler service, complimentary bicycles and complimentary use of beach items such as chairs, umbrellas and mats for the beach just steps away.
